lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We love you, Yev!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Our final episode of the year. So Sam, you have a few words on that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can go to backblaze.com/criticalrole for a full 15-day free trial, and I was going through my library. You know I have a whole library?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty impressive, actually.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah and I dug up an old poetry book and buried inside there was a very curious poem by a young Dr. Seuss.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's worth a lot of money.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know, I know. I thought I would read it for you all today.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Doesn't even look yellowed or anything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He printed it on his laser printer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But it happens to concern Backblaze. The drive did not spin. It just clacked and it clicked. I rebooted and prayed and gave it a swift kick. But my data was gone, poof, every byte and bit. And I cried, "How I wish I had backed up my shit!" But who should appear in a car that he revved? A zingity zangity furry red Yev. The Yev jumped through my window, he pounced on my mouse and said, "You must have wished Backblaze to your house." But I looked at him cross, shouting, "What "do you mean? My files are corrupt. This is one dead machine." He just laughed and said, "You daft "binkle blot, Backblaze works whether you remember or not. Your pics of your kids and the food that they "eated, all stored on the cloud. Nothing's ever deleted. Your docs, Firefox, alarm clocks, and "your socks will all be restored from our miracle box." The Yev yelled, "Don't worry from midnight "to morn, we save all your stuff, your taxes and porn. Your music and apps are safe on Backblaze." And with that, the Yev tipped his hat, "Good day." So remember, go visit backblaze.com and find the red Yev sing-singing his song. Let them take care of you heart and soul and tell him you're sent there by Critical Role.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Seuss or Lin-Manuel but that was great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was sweet and offensive. By the way, Sam, that's a very handsome hoodie you're wearing. I can't wait to open you up like an advent calendar later.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (yelling)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It looks like your tiny little weenus is--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're shirt-cocking your own mouth!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I am so happy!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's to inspire us in our final fights. It might be the last time I'm ever on this show, so I wanted it to be five of me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the power of five Sams. Thank you, Sam, and thank you, Backblaze, for being our awesome sponsor for our episode tonight. You guys are awesome. We have a great video for you to watch from them at the break.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait. Can I say, Yev, about the stuff? All the little pictures you see in the different videos, he's giving some of those away tonight? Giving some away! If you sign up for Backblaze or if you have signed up for Backblaze already, you're entered into the competition. And then you can win them, and we've signed them, and it's wonderful. Did I say it right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep, you did great.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. That's our sponsorship. Couple of other things to mention. We will be returning January 5th, will be our returning episode in 2017. The new year. We'll pick up wherever tonight leaves off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Those characters are going to be awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have so much faith in yourselves! It's very possible. No. So yeah, we'll be back January 5th. We wish you guys a very very merry holiday, in all your celebrations, and your families, and your New Year's, and all that crazy stuff. We'll have more of that at the end of the episode, but we'll see you back then. We have a merch shout-out, actually. Laura, if you want to talk about what we have up on the store for them?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a good question. I have no idea what's in the store tonight. I have no sheet in front of me, and I have no idea what's there. I think there's some hats left, I know there are some hats--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The dice got restocked.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, they did not. No, the dice did not get restocked, the dice are coming back in, like, January, so there's a lot more coming in January, so that's good. I have no idea what else is in the store though. A hat? There's a hat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit, I got nothing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You are the best.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You guys, I'm focused on spells, and I'm focused on arrows, and hit points and-- (gasps) And the patches! And our mugs!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you go to the Geek and Sundry store under Critical Role, you'll see merch! That's our announcement for the evening!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's still patches left, you guys! That's pretty cool! Yeah, the hats are still there. There's only a few left, though! There's only a few hats left, I know that for sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Only a few hats left.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: And they're gone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry. I'm stressed!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, tomorrow we have a last-minute special edition Signal Boost episode that is a stocking stuffer edition. Yeah, coming out tomorrow, and it's got, like, coupons in it, so you should watch it. And also: everyone likes coupons!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: End of statement. Also, there was a playlist that we put out that is a collection of all of the artists that we have boosted over the year.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Except one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Except for one because they're not on Spotify and it's not my fault. But yeah, go check it out and I also wrote a little thing giving some insight into the background of the show.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Marisha.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, not really, it's Christmas time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a pretty cool announcement. After a back and forth for the past year, we just got approval from Blizzard Entertainment to incorporate their music from their game projects into our Critical Role soundtrack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For the final fight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I've incorporated a few tracks for tonight's battle, as well as a couple of community-made tracks that have been submitted over time, so we'll have some fresh tracks for the evening. But, Blizzard, thank you so much, thank you to Woody Day, and a bunch of the guys who have helped out over there to make this happen. We're excited to include those amazing soundtracks into our atmospheric background tracks in future episodes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was not prepared. Oh! I'm fired, aren't I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you are. Anything else anyone wants to mention real fast?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: (distantly) Critmas!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back. So! Last we left off, Vox Machina, after spending the better part of a number of months traversing the Prime Material Plane and planes beyond in search of ancient relics known as the Vestiges of Divergence, they finally increased their abilities, they've made allies, and they've begun their trek to tear down the collection of evil chromatic dragons known as the Chroma Conclave that destroyed your city of Emon and took over most of the continent of Tal'Dorei and beyond. You've defeated and you've slain three members of the Conclave, allied with a fourth, and you've made your way, along with an army combined with the powers of Fort Daxio and Syngorn, to the central city of Emon. Utilizing aid from the Ashari people to cover the skies as the armies began to assault the outer walls, you, along with Zahra, Kashaw, Jarett, Gilmore, the whole party, everyone's there, Kima--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Britney Spears, NSYNC--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My other brother.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Drake's staying back with the army to help them with the assault. You guys made your way underneath through the sewer system, made a brief alliance with some wayward Clasp who led you to the center of town where the volcanic essence of Thordak's mutated draconic form has been pulling volcanic activity up beneath the city. You climbed out on top and there, at the walled gates to the central Cloudtop District, which Thordak now calls his home and his lair, you saw two fire giants guarding the entrance. Kashaw and Zahra, in a heroic display, bound the giants to place and decided to take care of them while you rushed into the fray, bursting through the door due to the strength of your Titanstone Gauntlets. You rushed into the cloud, smoke, and ember-filled Cloudtop District ruins, jumping from ruined building to wreck of rubble and stone. The air itself is dense and black with dark fume and it's hard to see anything. You all carefully, gingerly, stealthily made your way into the alcove of one ruined building, where across the way, you see a giant raised central cavern, a hole, a burrow, if you will, that is close to 40 feet across. Apparently, your approach was somewhat sensed by the red dragon himself, as you watch Thordak emerge from this burrow and climb out saying to itself, "It appears we have visitors." (sound of liquid pouring)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as Ashley unfortunately can not be with us, Pike's control and duty will be taken care of by the twins for the evening. You guys will be dual cleric-ing tonight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're Jaegering.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed. At this point in time, you guys are all keeping as still and as quiet as you can while figuring out your circumstances. You can hear the low growling voice of Thordak as he begins to scan the vicinity. (growling)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Potions! Potions!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, good idea, good idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I take fire resistance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fire resistance? Fire resistance, fire resistance--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Am I able to make a jello shot of invulnerability and haste at the same time?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you know they only last for one minute each. Just wait for like a second. Just wait. Fire resistance lasts for a while, I passed them out, so if you've got them, take them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so we have Scanlan, Keyleth, Vex, Grog, all with fire resistance? And Percy? All right. That's pretty much everyone but you, I believe, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, but he's got the armor--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you all guys quietly begin to drink and figure out your circumstances--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why are you laughing? Why'd you laugh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because I was rolling Thordak's perception check to see if he noticed any of your presences as you were drinking the potions. I got a natural one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, just drinking a potion would make him notice us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "I guess I'll go back to sleep now."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's still scanning, and he's still like, "We can sense you here. Where are you?" And you hear (heavy footsteps).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should I cause a distraction?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Pass Without a Trace on all of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What are the components of that spell? Let's take a look here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It can't be vocal because it's Pass Without a Trace-- oh no, it's verbal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I don't do that! I don't know what those things mean!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You better get your shit in gear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a whisper. Tell me it's a one! Tell me it's a one!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was not a one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, let's be clear, what are we really going to hide from? Look where his fucking head is. He's like the sun. We ain't hiding from that shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He may have heard us, but now we've got plus ten stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as you guys are all quietly huddled over in this broken space there, Vex'ahlia begins to do her incantation beneath her breath and as you feel the shadows cling to you, you hear in the distance, "Ah. There you are."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I just want to pee on myself and run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (screaming)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Already!? Take your potions!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can't, we're into initiative, right? It's too late for potions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's all you had time to do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's not too bad, not too bad.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That will do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who's rolling for Pike?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll do it. I got 11, plus what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think she has anything, so--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike has no bonus.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 14. Oh wait, you ask them, in order.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm freaking out, shit, I'm sorry, I thought I was helping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex, what did you get?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13 for you? All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 12, and Pike got 11.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pretty good for Pike.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: That is pretty good for Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's pretty good for Keyleth. Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 25. Fast, fast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eight. I'll be bringing up the rear. That's how I like it anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While we're cowering here, Pike says, "Guys, I think I could really help you out if you wait a "second. Okay?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Pike didn't even get a chance to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Were we supposed to have a Heroes' Feast?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We did, we did have a Heroes' Feast.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm so glad, I was totally here last week.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're all immune to fear and poison still, we all have advantage on wisdom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do indeed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And extra hit points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So! With that, beginning of the round, at the very top: Percival. You glance around the corner and you see sifting through the large columns of smoke that are billowing off each one of these destroyed, burning buildings, you see the gargantuan form of Thordak (heavy footsteps) and looks right over. You see all of a sudden as his eyes pass in your direction, almost like a cat caught in a light beam, as his eyes flare up with bright white light as it sees your presence.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you see?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's coming. Is there room, can I get even vaguely a shot in that room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From here, at his size, you could get a shot if you moved a little bit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll move a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jump between these folks there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have Spider Climb on right now, so actually I'll climb up on the wall and then climb back down when I'm done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to-- Ignore that, I've been drinking. First of all, I'm going to cast Hex on him. Because that's really going to make a difference.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, it is! Stay positive!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What kind of checks should I-- I'm going to down him for--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like he's real good at everything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like, wisdom, or something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 26 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a good sign.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And that's-- wow, I'm nervous!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's actually really good. First shot is 21, 37 points of damage plus five points of necrotic damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In addition to 37? That's nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's really nice. I rolled really high, and I have Sharpshooter running.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good opening shot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Next one, I'm going to shoot Sharpshooter, but no Deadshot. Is an 18 to hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, second one misses. I'm going to crawl back and hide again and get a little bit of-- yeah, I got up on top, took two shots, and crawled back down to hide.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, as you climb up to the top, you slam Bad News over the top of the stonework, and as soon as the barrel catches a little bit of the light through the smoke, you watch as Thordak's face whips over in your direction. (gunshot) The first shot smashes across the crest on the front of the dragon's face. You see sparks fly, and bits of flame, red crystal get shattered in the distance. The head spins back towards you, and immediately you start shaking, and you fire the second shot and it ricochets off of its angry, thick hide. You immediately duck back behind the wall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm regretting so many things right now! Not you! Oh god! I shouldn't avoid my family. It leads to dragons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In all of your focus, and all of your attention into the arrival, and the crawl into this, and Thordak, none of you noticed that Larkin is not with you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No surprise there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Piece of shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Piece of shit. Okay, I don't know what to do here? What are we trying to do? Do we have a plan? Should I try and burn a big spell?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do whatever you do! We've been practicing for this our whole lives.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, before I do something crazy, based off of Percy saying that, I turn to Vex and I go, by the way, I've been meaning to ask you about that, if he ever followed through, so stay alive, we can talk later! Okay! And I pop over the corner and I'm going to cast Tsunami?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've never heard you say those words.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it's not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're casting Tsunami.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She did this once and wrecked our enemies.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was Tidal Wave, this is like a big daddy version of that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's worse than that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is my 8th-level spell. So I create a wall 300 feet high, 300 feet long, and 50 feet thick of water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so, strength saving throw-- Wait, any Huge or smaller creature.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is he bigger than Huge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is bigger than Huge.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it doesn't have any effect on him? Is he bigger than 300 feet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, he's not bigger than 300 feet, is he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's big, but the sheer mass size-- You watch as the tidal wave smashes into Thordak and splits and falls around him, no effect. His form is too big--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: None at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The water crashes against him, he's too big for it to actually have an impact on him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are there any fires left burning in the vicinity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, this fire is out now, this fire goes out, and water spills down into the tunnel and you watch a bunch of steam (whoosh) rise out of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, it's also a six-round spell, and he's supposed to get stuck in it. Nothing? No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's too big.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He doesn't even get damaged at all, though?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does he question his choices in life?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because I'm questioning mine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It says any Huge or smaller creature inside the wall has to make a saving throw or take damage, creature caught in the wall can move, but yeah, it only seems to have an effect on--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, that was a valiant effort.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I was with you. But, hey, 8th-level spell!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You got tons of 8th-level spells, you'll be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "But, hey, 8th-level spell?" Did you just say that to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry! I'm sorry! I didn't mean to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy fuck.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No problem.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would get back behind the wall if I were you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Keyleth, do you want to use the rest of your movement?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't get back behind the fucking wall, don't get back behind the wall, we're all bunched up. Go somewhere else.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Scatter.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know how painful this is right now, Keyleth, but it looked really cool. Just run.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Our pores are cleared-- the steam--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The wall will at least take some damage at this point, most things he's going to do are going to be a giant area effect anyway that you're not going to be able to outrun, you might as well have cover--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, wait, hold on--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Judges weighing in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry, I scrolled past that part there-- Each creature has to make a saving throw, so it does affect him the first round. It does.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just on the first round, though?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Still, that's something!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Each turn after that-- so, yeah, basically as it gets smaller it affects less and less creatures. Sorry, I scrolled past that one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it just doesn't keep him restrained?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a 21.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's your spell DC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it takes half-- so roll 6d10 and it takes half damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's something!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's better than zero!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's better than-- yay, 8th-level spell, to quote Matt Mercer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That will be our next t-shirt, "Yay, 8th-level spell."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fine. keep digging. This is my battle against you guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not digging!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, not at all! We're very happy with that!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 26, 35, halved.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, half of the 35--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But it's not going to do anything to him on subsequent rounds?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 17 points, that's something!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there water all over the ground, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It says here that at the start of each of your turns after the wall appears, the wall along with any creatures in it move 50 feet away from you. So it will move him 50 feet back, unless he gets out of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it says any Huge or smaller creatures must make a strength saving throw in order to move.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. He can move through it fine, he's too big now, he doesn't take the additional damage in following rounds.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So he gets to move out of it no problem? Is that essentially the deal?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But he is picked up for 50 feet, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, but is he moved back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It still has to try and make an athletics check against your spell DC to move at all, but it doesn't take any additional damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, I'll take that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's her first time using this spell, guys, so be patient, we're figuring this out as we go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would say also just because Pike was going to do a thing, so come back for Pike's thing that she was going to do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike's going to do a thing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So is he.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like, run, Marisha, 'cause the thing that Pike's going to do is--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that an AOE thing that she's going to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but just go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, here's what I'm going to do, I'm going to move in this area over here. Kind of poke into this building?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's as far as you can get with your full movement.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, no, I don't want to go that way, I want to go behind-- sorry, this isn't very--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, that way. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That right there is as far as you can get with your full movement.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, sure. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's going to be great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's going to be so great, it's going to be great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that ends Keyleth's turn. Jarett is going to go ahead and rush around here. Pulling out his heavy crossbow, he's going to go ahead, as he runs past, releasing a bolt towards Thordak-- two bolts, actually, that is a-- nope, that misses. That also misses. Well, they both hit, but they both splinter across his hide. All right, Jarett's going to make the full move behind this wall and begin loading another bolt. "It's all right, we got this!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is now Gilmore's turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shaun Gilmore!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sorry. I don't know how I just stole two pencils.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gilmore is going to-- As he watches Jarett rush off and Keyleth rush back around the wall, watching the wall of water crash past the dragon, goes, "All right. It's been a while since I've had "to do this." And he points his finger up towards the dragon's head, and you watch as this green spark shoots this single green beam in the direction of the dragon's face.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Please hit his face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hit him, Gilmore!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's see if it makes its dexterity saving throw. That is-- yeah, he succeeds. Against the spell DC, yeah, he succeeds with a 19. He goes and fires and you watch as Thordak sees the beam glimmer out of the fingers and he ducks down and it fires past, dodging between the side of the head and the beam goes casting out that way, no effect.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit hammer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What level spell was that, Gilmore?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look at him and I go, yeah, 8th, I feel you, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's okay, we've got this."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fucking sucks, bro, all right, let's do this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he's going to go ahead and--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't understand all this arcane terminology.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Scatter, right?" He pushes past and goes running this way. All right, that's going to end his turn. Grog!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I see Gilmore take off running, and being there's a giant T-Rex on the map, I'm going to go, "Must go faster, must go faster--" And I would like to run as fast as balls this way towards this cover as far as I can for 50 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You get right about there, as Thordak has the same initiative as you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thordak, who has dodged the beam, and is seeing the ants begin to scatter in front, goes, "Moving targets--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Glad I joined Gilmore!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We love moving targets." And he's going to step forward--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! Don't move!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --and is going to rear back and (inhales) (whoosh) and unleash Flame Breath.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, Kiki, you're okay!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You made it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need Vex, Percy, Vax, Pike, Scanlan, Trinket, Grog, and Gilmore to all make dexterity saving throws. Hold on to that number.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does partial cover help at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. The flame is like napalm.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm rerolling that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kima fails. Gilmore rolls a one! Are you serious?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you roll for Pike?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a little better.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I Cutting Words to do anything?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Ancient Dragon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cutting Words actually can reduce the damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just the damage, not his attack?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll take the damage reduction.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Will it reduce the damage for everybody?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm double-checking that. I'm pretty sure it does.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If so, I will do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just had to use a Resolve.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A one. So I had to burn a Resolve, which I have done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so you can reduce the damage by a certain amount for everybody.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It won't be much, but I'll do it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It'll help.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then he's got disadvantage on something next, doesn't he? After you use Cutting Words?

lines.name: MATT, SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So as he goes, I will yell at him, oi! What sexual position makes the ugliest children? I don't know, ask your mama! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wow. That's a thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I like to think of all of Vox Machina nervously laughing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She has advantage on her saving throw-- Kima does make her saving throw! All right, so! Go ahead and roll your d12 and it will reduce the damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Guys, you can reduce that damage by five.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sweet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So instead of 150, it's 145.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, instead of 99 points of fire damage, it is 94.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 94 points of fire damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was 99, now it's 94.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does the five get subtracted before we halve it, or after?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It reduces the damage of the attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then if we have fire resistance, then it-- But what if we rolled 28, did we make our save?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, what was your--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit. He has to look?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just make it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 24 is a "just made it?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I take zero, because I'm using Evasion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes you do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I didn't have to roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18, nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21, nope.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And Trinket and Pike both fail as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Thankfully, that's half damage. So that would be, at half of 94, 37-- I'm sorry, no, 47. 47 points of fire damage to Grog, to Percy, to Scanlan--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike and Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, Trinket does not take half.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, I thought you said I didn't save.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Takes the full 90-- Trinket is in my necklace. Again, already.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket goes right into your necklace.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, wait, so I get 94 or 47?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You didn't succeed, so you would take 94, but because you have fire resistance, you take 47.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay! That's not bad!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take half of 47, because you have fire resistance and you made the save.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tell me he has only one of those per day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope, that regenerates.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would be 23.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And Matthew DM, do our temporary hit points go away first? Or last?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're technically not temporary, it's actually your max increases, so they can come back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, they can come back, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can heal into them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did somebody get temporary hit points?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 17, from our feast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's right, Pike has-- I need to--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're 17 up. You can go 17 up even if you lose them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, well I'm going to add them now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Your max is now much higher.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, thank you, that's much better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Kima's doing okay, but Gilmore is looking rough. As the flames burn through, hyper white, red, orange, blazing fire, you haven't felt heat like this before. You instinctively close your eyes, but it doesn't seem to help. As the flames pass by you, Keyleth, you can even feel the impact from here, singeing your eyebrows, and you have to cover your face for fear of being disfigured by the proximity. As the fire eventually burns away, Gilmore is like stumbling right now, burned all around. The rest of the party is already smoking, bits of your outfits and edges of clothing are now actually curling up and burning. That was bad. So that ends Thordak's go. Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, being that my run was so rudely interrupted by shit-chest over there, can I change course seeing that he's going to barf fire at all of us and run straight at him in a rage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you may.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, can we go ahead and see how we do here, and I will go Reckless Attack, Great Weapon Master.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Doesn't that mean he gets advantage on his attacks against you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I mean, let's buy the ticket and take the train, right? Who fucking knows. One! Better. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 misses.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit. Roll better. That's better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's so big, though!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But his armor is hard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is a 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 hits. So the second attack hits. Are you doing--?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Reckless and Great Weapon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, but I mean are you doing your frenzy for the third attack? Or are you going regular?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going frenzied!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 misses. But you did get a hit in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god. What was the second attack?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 25. So somewhere between 21 and 25. Which one is the d12? This one. 11. Two points of necrotic and 36 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look up into the beaming star-like eyes and angrily (yells). This time, the axe sinks in and the laughter stops. You see the slight twinge of pain in the right eye of the dragon as you pull back for a third one, brings its claw up and swings down to try and crush you. As you swing for your attack, you instinctually realize it's probably best to let this go and you duck out of the way in time as the claw (slam) into the ground in front of you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Yeah! Fuck. That ends my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex! Your turn!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool! I click my Boots of Haste!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel, for the first time, the adrenaline surge through you and you suddenly go, "My "brother's been hoarding this this whole time?!" Everything slows down around you ever so slightly, and for a second, your mind's racing faster than it normally does.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With my full movement, can I get behind the wall up where Keyleth was headed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can move 60 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to stop in a place where I can attack before I finish my move.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'll go over there and as you're rushing past, Keyleth--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As she rushes past, she hears: (slowly) Those are just a loaner!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to cast Hunter's Mark. Then, for my first attack, I'm going to try a Bramble Shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, by the way, I need you to make a concentration check. It's a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes! 30 on the first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your Hex fades.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. 15 plus two lightning damage plus two sneak attack and a Hunter's Mark. Ooh! 12 plus 4d8 for the Bramble Shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice! So already at 29 damage plus--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus 17. All right! 46 points of damage on the first strike! What's the DC on the strength saving throw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. He makes it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would have been amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you run past and fire the first arrow, it sinks in and jams into the side of where the plates of the chest armor meet the scar. As it hits, you watch it cause a spurt of dragon blood, knowing exactly where the weak points of the armor are, being a person that studied dragons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! That's right! And an additional d6 because he's a dragon, right? 2d6?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You should have the additional damage, I think it was plus two damage against creatures that are--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, just plus two.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 2d20 of damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought it was a d6. Sorry. You're right, I think.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you want to go look it up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's fine. I'll look it up between. My next attack, I want to try one of my poisoned arrows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the brambles extend out from the arrow and the dragon leans forward, already focused on Grog as you're slamming him in the side. As his body flexes, the brambles shatter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27 hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, and then I'm going to do a third attack, right? Because I am hasted.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And that hits too! That's 31!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Damn, girl.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 16 plus another four lightning damage! Plus Hunter's Mark, plus two plus two, because he is a dragon. But I didn't do plus two on the second one because I--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then I finish my round of movement and I keep running behind the building. Yeah. Right there. I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you rush past, looking up into the face of the creature that you know for certain, seeing it there, that this is the creature that brought your mother to her end and half the city of Byroden to the south. And as that anger swells into you and mixes with the surge of adrenaline in your body and you don't even feel the momentum, your hands instinctively go through all training, all the years that have gone by, as each arrow gets loosed, there is just kind of this fuzz, this kind of numbness, around as your hatred is focused so clear on this dragon's head. And then the air rushes back into your lungs and you slam your back into the wall, preparing for your next round. All right, that finishes Vex's go. Vax and Lady Kima go at the same time. What do you want to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am going to down the potion of healing with a bonus action.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And then now I have two actions because of the potion--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The potion of healing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, no. Haste. So that's bonus action, now I have two actions? Because of the potion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Second action's used to pump out the wings.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Wings are up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then I am going to fly directly towards Thordak's face to-- you don't need that-- to ten feet away from him to his face. you can just hold it for a second, and cast Vow of Enmity at him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And then I am going to barrel roll back, fly, and land hard right down next to my sister where she's hiding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. At a non-hasted fly speed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 120, hasted.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yeah, not a problem. Land right next to your sister.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So you prayed at him? Good job!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You swoop up, right in front, you cast the Vow of Enmity.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He could have taken a swipe at me. I'm just glad he didn't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, but we are going to get there. As you swoop up within ten feet of his face and cast the Vow, focusing on him, the dragon grins, and as you pull out of his attack space, because he has a reach of 15 feet with his bite, he is going to take a bite attack at you. That is a 32 to hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I Uncanny Dodge this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. I have to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 32 to hit?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're fucked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's actually a bad roll. 17 points of piercing damage plus--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I knew it was going to happen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus 16 points of fire damage reduced to half.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, 17 plus 16 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, because you have fire resistance that is reduced.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. So eight and 17. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, 25 points of damage to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Gives me advantage on every attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will get sneak attack on every attack whether there's someone next to him or not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good! That's really good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kima is going to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who that? Who that? Is that Kima?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's Kima. Kima can't do too much at this distance, unfortunately. She is going to cast Aura of Vitality on herself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On herself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let me pull it up real fast. Let's see, Aura of Vitality. She can use a bonus action to cause a creature in the aura, including herself, to regain hit points. She's doing okay. She looks over at Gilmore, who's hurt on the ground, staggering over in flames. As she rushes up, casts the spell on herself, holding her holy symbol of Bahamut to her chest, she looks up at the dragon. "Remember me?" Without even losing her vision, she puts her hand out like this, and you watch as a beam of divine energy streaks out, slams into Gilmore's side. He almost doubles over as it swirls around his body and heals his wounds for 2d6.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So he heals four hit points.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's looking better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike's turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: By committee.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, we're going to move to the corner of the building that she's standing in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Inside. Squished into the corner.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Ten feet of movement to get there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. She's going to, as a bonus action, cast Spiritual Weapon. At fifth level.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I'll mark that off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Go nuts with it, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What else is she doing this round?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then she's also going to cast Beacon of Hope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beacon of Hope is a 3rd-level spell. If you are casting a 3rd-level or higher spell as an action, you can only do a 2nd-level spell as a bonus action. So you can either do Beacon of Hope and then a 2nd-level Spiritual Weapon or--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we should do Beacon of Hope and not do Spiritual Weapon because we want to do a higher Spiritual Weapon later?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So anyone within 30 feet of her is getting some nice things.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So anybody within 30 feet gets advantage on wisdom, which you already have, but you get advantage on death saving throws as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the best part--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: --is any time you're healed, you're automatically healed to the max possible amount.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you mean any time you're healed?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When someone heals you, you don't roll. You calculate the maximum amount you could possibly roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And that's what you're healed for.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So, if it's 3d4, you just get 12. That's amazing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we get any healing from this as well?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, this is a prep spell. This is something that probably we should have done before Thordak started attacking us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, well, you're not Pike. You don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So, DM. Who all gets that? Looks like Grog is just out of reach of it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Within 30 feet of her? Grog is just out of the radius. Gilmore, Kima.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we have run around the corner? If we had run around the corner, would Grog get?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you run to there? Okay, yeah. That would get Grog, Gilmore, Scanlan, Percy, Keyleth. It does not get either of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, that's fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This looks bad, but I feel okay about this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that's your action?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And that gets Pike in that as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You get a bonus action.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bonus action?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can do a Healing Word.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's right, Healing Word!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can do up to a level two.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so she should do a Healing Word. Is Healing Word a level two?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can do it at any level you like.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percy needs it? Grog needs it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog needs it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I took like 40 points of damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like he's okay still, so Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One of the two of us, I would say.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I didn't get hit. I'm good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I'll take it. How much do I get back?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: At a level two, that's 2d4.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 2d4 plus five.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that for everybody or just for her?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike can technically move five more feet from where she is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But she can't hide, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll move ten feet towards that way, still ducking behind that stone there. I will inspire Percy. Wait, should I heal or inspire? I'll inspire Percy. I'll sing him a lovely Christmas song, (singing) You know Raishan and Vorugal, the Frigid Doom, Brimscythe and Umbrasyl, we killed in his room. But do you recall the most fucked-up dragon of all? Thordak the Cinder King had a very shiny gem. And if you ever saw it, run the fuck away from him.

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Legendary? Did he do his legendary thingy? Or he just made it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, he also has to save against my Contagion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His turn's not done yet. Raishan uses her legendary resistance to resist the-- Oh sorry, she doesn't have to because she made it. From the shaking and the quaking you watch as the flames that brighten up leap out of the sides in the form of two fire elementals.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Damn it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That leap out of the sides of the cavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can they fly?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we bring all the alcohol on set right now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a lot of alcohol on the set right now. A lot of it's hiding.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How about acknowledge it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a mini fridge built into Trinket.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ancient dragon wasn't enough, huh, Matt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thordak is going to move around Grog to this side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, move around me, bitch. I'm going to get my insults in while I'm still breathing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He accidentally stepped on one of his elemental friends.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 50 feet. Ten, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40, 45, 50. This elemental. 35, 40, 45, 50. Right there. They're going to rush up and get into base to base with you guys, and up to Keyleth, who's currently on the ground prone as the elemental (roar) and comes up against you. You hear the familiar sound of the flickering flame of its elemental form rush up towards you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like I saw you, in like the fire plane! 'Sup, man?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. At this time, you also hear a distant sound in the sky. A (sharp whooshes), but you make no visual. Everyone roll a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I get advantage because it's dragon-related?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is not dragon-related.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Scanlan, you rolled a 21, you said?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, Scanlan, Keyleth, and Vax. You guys see a shape in the darkness of clouds and the smoke ahead. In between the sounds of thunder and lightning in the distance, you see the bow of the skyship Deera.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, the skyship!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fucking Teddy Ruxpin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Vex, it's your turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me? Okay. Where can I go to where I can hit him?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pretty much anywhere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you'd have to move around this way or this way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is the fire elemental right next to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is. It'll get a swipe at you if you try to move away from it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Asshole. If I'm a third level rogue, do I get disengage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As a bonus action, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so for my bonus action I'll disengage. And then I'll move so I can hit Thordak. So can I move towards-- back towards the very back building? Can I get all the way there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With Haste, yes, you can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. So then I'm going to shoot him! Before I duck in around a corner or whatever. And I want to-- oh, that's 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 does not hit. So you rush past, disengaging. You hit up against the edge of the wall with your arrow out (arrow whoosh). It arcs past and misses.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to use another poison arrow. Oh my God, I miss him again. Dice jail!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That one hits the hide but ricochets off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay okay. Third attack. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's nine, 13. Plus 13.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, that's many points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So a total of--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 30. Nice. All righty. So the final arrow releases and (whoosh) gets stuck up under one of the scales on the side of where its shoulder and body hits and the dragon, Thordak, turns and (roars and laughs).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, I hide behind that building.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, God. What was that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Those faces are-- wow!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, way too many emotions happening there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear the voice ring out, "Don't worry, we'll take them down. All of them. Each and every one."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's crazy as fuck.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's straight-up crazy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, he's not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn, Vex?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess so, I mean, I don't know what else I can do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Vax and Kima.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When I was younger, I had an imaginary friend, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Should I go, or should Kima go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles) Kima, frustratingly so, being a short-ranged lady that she is, is first off going to glance over and see Keyleth on the ground. How are you doing, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm okay. I'm on the ground, but I'm not super low. I'm still full on hit points. Well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, she's going to go full double move on this one. She wants to get into the fray and is so frustrated that she's too far out of the way. Kima is going to go ahead and rush out and do a 2d6 heal to Gilmore again. So that's seven to Gilmore.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, well he gets full healing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh that's right. 2d6, so it's a full 12.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's so clutch. We should do that every time from now on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, she's charging in. "We've done this before "and we can do it again!" as she has her Holy Avenger arcing over her shoulder, running screaming. (yells) Vax, what are you doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bonus action, I'm taking the potion of invulnerability.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Time to get crunk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Next action, I cast Hunter's Mark on Thordak.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can do that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Face. Face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, so you're up in the air now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: At advantage. Good. 26 hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, it does.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So this is dragon-slayer sword plus Sneak Attack, I'm going to Smite and Hunter's Mark.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's all the attacks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, all the attacks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Every die.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, nine plus six is 17, plus-- 18, 19, 21, balls. 21, okay plus the Sneak Attack. 27, 29, 33, 39, 40, 42, 44, plus the Hunter's Mark, 45 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That includes the Smite damage as well?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's 2d8.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now we're at 50.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What about the dragon sword? Did you do that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's done. So I don't know exactly how far it was to his face and I know I'm all out of moves and I'm open to getting bitten again, but I want to fly away from his face as far as I can and land opposite everybody. Maybe near the lip. No, behind the building behind him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm currently working out how much movement you've done, because you're crazy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 120 feet of movement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about 65 to get up to his face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, sweet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and you're going to pull back from him?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Curve over his, oh, no-- sword's in his head? My friends are going to fucking kill you today, you fuck! Arc over his head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The blade, which has jammed itself right in the cheekbone under the eye of the dragon, as you draw it out, there's a streak of dragon blood (roar, unhinged laughter). You arc over. As you do, he reaches up with his face, his jaws (snarl) reach out to try and bite you. That is a 21 to hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The jaws snap in the air, just as you coast through with your wings.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll slam down, if I can, behind the building behind his big fat ass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I whisper on the earring, that was my brother! That was my brother.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are going to have an attack of opportunity from-- oh, no, you disengaged from the--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I didn't disengage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, sorry, so the Fire Elemental actually would have gotten an attack of opportunity on you as you ran past.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Before all that, he knocks you unconscious.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a 20-- yeah, misses.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vax, it might be worth taking a peek in that crater when you get a second.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Working on it, working on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, that ends your turn, Kima's turn. Pike's up. However! At the end of Vax's turn, Thordak is going to go ahead and use a tail attack against Grog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did he ever make that save, by the way?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disadvantage, which is good because it was a natural 20. And a six, plus 16, 22. Makes it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 22. He's got to roll under a four or lower to get--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's no way, it's not going to happen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's possible! It's possible!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It keeps going. It still goes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It keeps going. It lasts for seven days.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's a seven-day thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: After we're all dead, he'll get very sick.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we die today, he's going to get the flu later in his life.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's reason with him! You can die now, wait for later--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "That doesn't look normal."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Why does it burn when I pee?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, it lasts for seven days, but remember, that's if the spell succeeds. If he succeeds three saving throws, it goes away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If he succeeds three?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought he just had to fail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fail three to take effect, succeed three to just get rid of the disease.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just dish out damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: These damn spells.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He has disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, anyway, that brings us to Pike. Oh, he was doing the tail attack to you. So, using one of the Legendary Actions to make a tail strike against--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So Legendaries can fall whenever they want?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the end of someone else's turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is against me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, because you're right there. With advantage. That would be 31. So yeah, that hits you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I pray for a single-digit number.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Almost double my AC.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 points of bludgeoning damage, reduced to ten.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Man, you are a tank.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not much longer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're working on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So, Pike, what's Pike doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, Pike is going to run forward--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "Oh, Grog!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "Oh, Grog!" And she runs as far forward as she can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's as far as she can get.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're trying to get a little diagonal, she wants to be 60 feet away from him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's within 60 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Can she be at a diagonal so she's not lined up with Keyleth and Bigby?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, that's as far as she can get.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Then she casts Heal on Grog, which gives him 70 hit points, automatically healed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's amazing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. So you're up 70 hit points, Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And that's a 6th-level spell, so she's going to cast Spiritual Weapon as a 5th-level spell as her bonus action.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She can't, because she already cast a 6th-level spell. If you do a spell that's higher than 2nd-level, you can only do a 2nd-level spell as your bonus action.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Technically, rules as written, you can't do that, but as we've been playing, for the sake of having so many players, I allow bonus action spells as long as they're level two or lower.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we just do it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If she does it at a 2nd-level, then--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And it'll keep going.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But what happens if you do it at a higher level?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: More damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well yeah, but she's always going to be at a higher level than 2nd-level spells, so it doesn't matter.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I mean, like, next round though, if she does that at a 5th-level, just the damage it'll add will be more than double the damage it'll do now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's keeping Grog alive.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you might want to do that at a lower spell level, and keep the higher levels for healing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay. Wait-- okay, she can also do Mass Healing Word as a bonus action at-- never mind, that's a 3rd-level spell, so fuck it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She can do Healing Word, though! At second level.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we do that? Who needs healing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, everybody.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's going to do Healing Word on Grog again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: At max.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So at second level, that means that's 2d4 plus five. So 13, you heal 13 hit points.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's great. It's like one more attack to absorb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For my attack, I will punch the fire elemental currently menacing Kiki with my fist of fury.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, go ahead and roll a spell attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It would have hit the fucking dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would've. So 8d8 points of damage to the fire elemental.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 8d8. I need all the d8s.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All the d8s.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here, I've got d8s, how many do you need?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, Scanlan. (mimes playing a flute)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's seven.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughs) Oh man, these are all good, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So you want one more, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 41 points of damage, nice! It slams into his form and you watch as his body kind of tears open for a second, the flames dissipating and then form back in, but they're starting to flicker.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's not dead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As my bonus action, I'll punch him again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No bonus.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was my action, as a bonus action, I can do something else with Bigby, no?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let me double check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Every subsequent action I can do something as a bonus action, does that also negate the action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So your action is there, I'll say-- it says specifically bonus action.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I can't do it as my action?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So you can do something else!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So that was my bonus action, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, to do that is your bonus.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I can do something else, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll let you do it again if you want to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, no, no, I'll do something else. Oh! By the way, I can't use my movement to drink a potion, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay (laughs).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) I'd like to drink a potion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I lean over the wall there? And I'll Lightning Bolt the same guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So it would be over the edge of that wall there and (blasting noise). All right, go for it. So that's a no. That is a 12 for its dexterity saving throw, so it takes full damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, so.

lines.name: TALIESIN, SAM
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I made up for some of them. 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 points of lightning damage against the fire elemental. Okay, the bolt hits it and the fire elemental goes (sizzling), not terribly damaged by the impact.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: At least it didn't point and laugh at you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, do you want to stay where you are?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, absolutely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that ends Scanlan's turn. Up to the top: Percival.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He used your full first name.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, okay, that's fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like when you're in trouble.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am in trouble. I have a whole bunch of your d8s over here, by the way. Feel free to pull them out whenever you like. I'm going to try a couple things. I'm going to do a piercing shot on the fire elemental, which I think I can do. I'm going to start moving in a northerly direction, so I guess I'll take like one or two steps southwest, I suppose it would be to you. Yeah, there you go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that'll do it. And I'm going to do a piercing shot. That burns a grit, okay. That'll do! That's 25 to hit the elemental.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And now I have to roll again for Thordak?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because it's a straight line, and it hits-- depending on how you angle it, you're either hitting Kima or you're hitting Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm saying Kima's not actually attached to a human being, just saying.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Kima's not short enough that it'll go right over her head?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. As per the rules as designed, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I totally love Kima, I got nothing against her. Just looking out for myself right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's parkouring off of the damaged wall, trying to get into the fray with the dragon, and happens to catch where the bullet would be going.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, that's happening, apparently.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you shooting Kima?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's either Kima or Grog. Although Grog takes half damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is true.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, okay, come on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You take half damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. I'll remember this later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Grog it is? Roll for attack against Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, his head is so high. How are you hitting Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's in the rules.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's in the rules.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In theory, from this angle, in to hit the fire elemental and Thordak, he has to aim up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20? Against Grog hits?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And roll against Thordak.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And, no. I can't have a misfire once I've already hit the first?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, only the additional attack can misfire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. That's 15, that doesn't hit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So you only hit Grog.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I only hit Grog. No, I also hit the fire elemental.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll damage once.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I hit the fire elemental, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe you'll kill it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where are my d12s, they seem to have all vanished.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kill it! Oh, jeez. Come on, man.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's awful. 13 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Grog, you take 13 points of piercing damage, halved to six. Round it down. Six.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sorry! And the bullet gets lodged in you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, basically.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's there for 50 years.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sorry! And then, is the fire elemental still standing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, it is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's actually no save, that's just a pushback. I just have to hit. And that hits, I should have done a-- that's a 29, 32 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 32 to hit. That'll hit, go ahead and roll damage. And it just gets pushed back ten feet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm saving you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I could have handled it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And it gets pushed back ten feet. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Its form gets knocked back, coalesces again as a flickering flame creature. It's looking hurt, it's barely keeping its form together at this point, it's still standing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then I'm going to keep running, use spider to run over that wall into that little house beneath the green dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Spider-climb is cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Little house on the prairie, with the dragon on it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There we go.
